p:
We have studied single crystals of Hg1201 grown by two different techniques. For p ≈ 0.11 and 0.125, small single crystals were grown by a solid-state reaction method
35, 36 . For p ≈ 0.12, a small crystal was cut from a large crystal grown by a flux method
37 . The hole concentration for p ≈ 0.12 was controlled by annealing the crystal at high temperatures under oxygen atmosphere. The hole-doping levels were determined from the superconducting transition temperature T c by magnetisation measurements
36 . Supplementary Fig. 1a–c shows the temperature dependence of the normalised magnetisation measured for p ≈ 0.11, 0.12 and 0.125, respectively. The crystals exhibit sharp superconducting transitions with T c of 86, 90 and 94 K for p ≈ 0.11, 0.12 and 0.125, respectively. The directions of the crystalline axes were determined by X-ray diffraction measurements.
